sen.j: 貝原 益軒（かいばら えきけん、1630年12月17日（寛永7年11月14日 (旧暦)） - 1714年10月5日（正徳 (日本)4年8月27日 (旧暦)））は江戸時代の本草学者、儒学者。
sen.e: Ekiken KAIBARA (December 17, 1630 - October 5, 1714) was a scholar of herbalism and of Confucianism who lived during the Edo Period.
Ekiken KAIBARA (December 17, 1630 - October 5, 1714) was a herbalist and Confucianist who lived during the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 「a scholar of herbalism and of Confucianism」 → 『a herbalist and Confucianist』に、簡潔にするために変更しました。
sen.e: Ekiken KAIBARA (December 17, 1630 - October 5, 1714) was a herbalist and Confucianist who lived during the Edo Period.

sen.j: 筑前国（現在の福岡県）福岡藩士、貝原寛斎の五男として生れる。
sen.e: He was born as a fifth son of Kakusai KAIBARA, a feudal retainer of the Fukuoka Domain, Chikuzen Province (present-day Fukuoka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 貝原寛斎：読み方不明です。
sen.e: He was the fifth son of Kansai KAIBARA, a feudal retainer of the Fukuoka Domain, Chikuzen Province (present-day Fukuoka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: ・「born as a fifth son」 → 『the fifth son』に変更＆修正しました。 ・「Kakusai KAIBARA」 → 『Kansai KAIBARA』に修正しました。
sen.e: He was the fifth son of Kansai KAIBARA, a feudal retainer of the Fukuoka Domain, Chikuzen Province (present-day Fukuoka Prefecture).

sen.j: 名は篤信、字は子誠、号は柔斎、損軒（晩年に益軒）、通称は久兵衛。
sen.e: His first name was Atsunobu, his Azana (a name received upon reaching an adulthood) was 子誠, his Go (a pseudonym or pen name) was 柔斎 and Sonken (in his later years, Ekiken) and his common name was Kyubei.
sen.cmt: 子誠、柔斎、損軒、久兵衛：読み方不明です。
sen.e: His first name was Atsunobu, his Azana (a name received upon reaching an adulthood) was 子誠, his Go (a pseudonym or pen name) was 柔斎 and Sonken (in his later years, Ekiken) and his common name was Kyubei.
sen.cmt: 子誠、柔斎：読み方不明です。
sen.e: His first name was Atsunobu, his Azana (a name received upon reaching an adulthood) was 子誠, his Go (a pseudonym or pen name) was 柔斎 and Sonken (in his later years, Ekiken) and his common name was Kyubei.

sen.j: 成長し福岡藩に仕えたが、二代藩主黒田忠之の怒りに触れ7年間の浪人生活を送ることとなる。
sen.e: Although Ekiken grew up to serve for the Fukuoka Domain, he enraged the second lord of the Domain, Tadayuki KURODA and was forced to lead a ronin (masterless samurai) life for seven years.
Although Ekiken served the Fukuoka Domain, he enraged the second lord of the Domain, Tadayuki KURODA, so he was forced to lead a ronin (masterless samurai) life for seven years.
sen.cmt: ・「grew up to serve for」 → 『served』に修正しました。・「 and」→ 『, so he was』に変更しました。
sen.e: Although Ekiken served the Fukuoka Domain, he enraged the second lord of the Domain, Tadayuki KURODA, so he was forced to lead a ronin (masterless samurai) life for seven years.

sen.j: 三代藩主黒田光之に許される。
sen.e: He was then allowed by the third lord of the Fukuoka Domain, Mitsuyuki KURODA.
He was then allowed by the third lord of the Fukuoka Domain, Mitsuyuki KURODA.
He was then allowed by the third lord of the Fukuoka Domain, Mitsuyuki KURODA.

sen.j: 藩費による京都留学で本草学や朱子学等を学ぶ。
sen.e: Ekiken stayed in Kyoto for a while at the expense of the Domain to learn herbalism and Neo-Confucianism.
Ekiken learned herbalism and Neo-Confucianism in Kyoto at the expense of the Fukuoka Domain.
Ekiken learned herbalism and Neo-Confucianism in Kyoto at the expense of the Fukuoka Domain.

sen.j: このころ木下順庵、山崎闇斎、松永尺五らと交友を深める。
sen.e: Around that time, he developed a deep friendship with Junan KINOSHITA, Junan KINOSHITA and Sekigo MATSUNAGA.
Around that time, he developed a deep friendship with Junan KINOSHITA, Ansai YAMAZAKI and Sekigo MATSUNAGA.
sen.cmt: 「Junan KINOSHITA, Junan KINOSHITA」 → 『Junan KINOSHITA, Ansai YAMAZAKI』に修正しました。
sen.e: Around that time, he developed a deep friendship with Junan KINOSHITA, Ansai YAMAZAKI and Sekigo MATSUNAGA.

sen.j: 帰藩後、藩内での朱子学の講義や、朝鮮通信使への対応をまかされ、また佐賀藩との境界問題の解決に奔走するなど重責を担った。
sen.e: After his return to the Fukuoka Domain, Ekiken was assigned with heavy responsibilities including teaching Neo-Confucianism to the Domain samurais, handling all the matters associated with the correspondents to Korean Peninsula and solving a territorial dispute with Saga Domain.

After returning to the Fukuoka Domain, Ekiken bore heavy responsibilities for duties such as giving lectures of Neo-Confucianism, dealing with Korean envoys and solving a territorial dispute with the Saga Domain.
sen.cmt: ・「After his return to」 → 『After returning to』に修正しました。・「was assigned with」 → 『bore』に変更しました。・「responsibilities including」 → 『responsibilities for duties such as』に変更しました。・「teaching Neo-Confucianism to the Domain samurais」 → 『giving lectures of Neo-Confucianism』に変更しました。・「handling all the matters associated with the correspondents to Korean Peninsula」 → 『dealing with Korean envoys』に修正しました。・「Saga Domain」 → 『the Saga Domain』に修正しました。
sen.e: After returning to the Fukuoka Domain, Ekiken bore heavy responsibilities for duties such as giving lectures of Neo-Confucianism, dealing with Korean envoys and solving a territorial dispute with the Saga Domain.

sen.j: 藩命により「黒田家譜」を編纂。
sen.e: Ekiken compiled the 'Genealogical Table of the KURODA Family' upon the request from the Domain.
Ekiken compiled the 'Genealogical Table of the KURODA Family' by the order of the Domain.
sen.cmt: 「upon the request from the Domain.」 → 『by the order of the Domain.』に修正しました。
sen.e: Ekiken compiled the 'Genealogical Table of the KURODA Family' by the order of the Domain.

sen.j: また、藩内をくまなく歩き回り「筑前国続風土記」を編纂する。
sen.e: He also compiled the 'Fudoki (descriptions of regional climate, culture, etc.) of Chikuzen Province Second Edition' by traveling throughout the Domain.
He also compiled the 'Fudoki (descriptions of regional climate, culture, etc.) of Chikuzen Province Second Edition' by traveling throughout the Domain.
He also compiled the 'Fudoki (descriptions of regional climate, culture, etc.) of Chikuzen Province Second Edition' by traveling throughout the Domain.

sen.j: 幼少のころから読書家で、非常に博識であった。
sen.e: Ekiken had liked reading since his childhood and had a wide knowledge of various matters.
Ekiken had liked reading since his childhood and had a wide knowledge of various matters.
Ekiken had liked reading since his childhood and had a wide knowledge of various matters.

sen.j: ただし書物だけにとらわれず自分の足で歩き目で見、手で触り、あるいは口にすることで確かめるという実証主義的な面を持つ。
sen.e: Having been a positivist, he gained knowledge not only from books, but also from his experience through walking, seeing, using hands and tasting.
Having been a positivist, he gained knowledge not only from books, but also from his experience through walking, seeing, using hands and tasting.
Having been a positivist, he gained knowledge not only from books, but also from his experience through walking, seeing, using hands and tasting.

sen.j: また世に益することを旨とし、著書の多くは平易な文体で書かれより多くの人に判るように書かれている。
sen.e: Also, as Ekiken put an importance on benefiting the society, he used simple words when writing most of his books so that many ordinary people could understand them easily.
Also, as Ekiken put an importance on benefiting the society, he used simple words when writing most of his books so that many ordinary people could understand them easily.
Also, as Ekiken put an importance on benefiting the society, he used simple words when writing most of his books so that many ordinary people could understand them easily.

sen.j: 70歳で役を退き著述業に専念。
sen.e: Ekiken retired at the age of 70 and dedicated himself into writing later on.
Ekiken retired at the age of 70 and dedicated himself into writing later on.
Ekiken retired at the age of 70 and dedicated himself into writing later on.

sen.j: 著書は生涯に六十部二百七十余巻に及ぶ。
sen.e: He completed 270 books during his life.
He completed 270 books during his life.
He completed 270 books during his life.

sen.j: 主な著書に『大和本草』、『菜譜』、『花譜』といった本草書。
sen.e: His masterpieces include books on herbs, such as "Yamato-honzo", "菜譜" and "花譜".
His masterpieces include books on herbs, such as "Yamato-honzo," "Nafu" and "Kafu."
sen.cmt: 「"Yamato-honzo", "菜譜" and "花譜".」→ 『"Yamato-honzo," "Nafu" and "Kafu."』に修正しました。
sen.e: His masterpieces include books on herbs, such as "Yamato-honzo," "Nafu" and "Kafu."

sen.j: 教育書の『養生訓』、『和俗童子訓』、『五常訓』。
sen.e: His educational books include "Yojo kun" (precepts for the preservation of health), "Wazoku Doji kun" (precepts for education), and "Gojo kun" (precepts for five eternal virtues).
His educational books include "Yojo kun" (precepts for the preservation of health), "Wazoku Doji kun" (precepts for education), and "Gojo kun" (precepts for five eternal virtues).
His educational books include "Yojo kun" (precepts for the preservation of health), "Wazoku Doji kun" (precepts for education), and "Gojo kun" (precepts for five eternal virtues).
His philosophical books include "Taigi roku".
His philosophical books include "Taigi roku."

sen.j: 紀行文には『和州巡覧記』がある。
sen.e: His travel books include "Washu Junkan ki" (a travel in Yamato Province).
